[h1] Hinter den Kulissen [/h1]

Bei „Half-Life 2: Lost Coast“ handelt es sich um eine spielbare Techdemo, in denen die Entwickler des guten Hauptspiels ein paar für damals revolutionäre Techniken, aber auch teilweise das Design erklären. Unterwegs spielt man sich noch 15 Minuten lang durch ein kurzes Level und sieht dabei ein paar Ideen, die ursprünglich für das eigentliche Spiel geplant war.  Aber auch so kann man für ein paar Combines weniger auf dem Planeten sorgen.

[b]Fazit[/b]
Zu diesem „Spiel“ gibt es nicht viel zu sagen. Für Interessierte an der Grafik und der Programmierung ist es ganz interessant. Ansonsten kann man „Lost Coast“ vielleicht als einen kleinen Bonus zum Hauptspiel sehen. Es ist eine schöne Idee und hilft dabei, die großartige Entwicklung des Spiels zu verstehen. Und man erfährt am Ende die E-Mail Adresse von Gabe Newell, dem Chef von Valve und damit von Steam. Also wenn es das nicht schon wert ist?

Hier gibt es übrigens mein Review zum eigentlichen [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Drakezero/recommended/220/] „Half-Life 2“ [/url]

Lust auf mehr Reviews? Dann schau doch mal in meiner Gruppe [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] Drakezeros Gameschool[/url] vorbei!

An enjoyable map for halflife 2, showing off neat source engine features and improvements. It’s also the first instance of valve’s developer commentary mode, which I ABSOLUTELY love and am a big fan of. It’s also free if you’ve bought halflife 2, and who hasn’t, so why not give it a shot?

El sonido rígido de mostrar y contar no importaría mucho en otra parte, pero esto se debe a las personas que hicieron temibles a las feromonas ya los robots que son nuestros amigos, y lo que tienen que decir es tan interesante y perspicaz que darnos cuenta de que la próxima leyenda se convierte en un incentivo suficiente para mantenerse en sintonía. Y cuando el director de Gabe Newell, repleto de ideas, pero nunca tan lleno, ofrece su dirección de correo electrónico y nos pide su opinión, de inmediato sabemos qué solicitar: dale a HL2 el tratamiento también, por favor.

Хорошо игра советую

I had ran across a Half-Life documentary online and I decided to play some of the series. I wasn't really sure where to begin, after having not played most of them, plus not having played through 1, 2, 2.1 and 2.2 within the last few years. I decided to fire up one that I hadn't played, which was this one, without knowing what it was. 

I went to settings and get everything primmed (I had to turn on mouse acceleration and set my native resolution.) For the heck of it, I put it on max, seeing as how Source engine is old enough that even a midrange laptop should be able to handle it beautifully. 

And it did. 

I clicked "new game" and was gestured to turn on the developer commentary. Seeing as how I had *just* watched a documentary, I decided that it would be a good idea to turn it on. I think that was the right choice. I stepped into the Lost Coast and was greeted with a beautiful landscape... and quirky floating conversation bubbles. Had you not read the dialogue box where you were asked to enable the commentary, you'd have no idea what to do, but hopefully one would have the natural instinct to interact with it (Use). 

They provide a delightful showcase on the engine and various components around it, seemingly only missing the audio-element - although maybe this was one of the 14 speech bubbles I missed. I'm fairly sure I got all of them, but there was no real way to tell. 

Without the commentary I think the game is about 20 minutes in length, and with it maybe 30. I was a little remiss, as if I'd known it were brief, I'd have not tried to cheese my way through the vertical level design. But then again... maybe that's the spirit of Half-Life. 

The elements themselves are all stellar. The level design, objectives they push you to do, and challenges the players faces are all highlighted in the commentary and it provides this amazing dialogue with the player and the game, and the player with themselves. Multiple times through the settings I would have dialogue with myself about the beaut- Oh FUCK COMBINE - Ahhh such a nice view from the cliffsid- Holy SHIT they can rappel?

I don't know how much I paid, but I've paid $60 for worse experiences so...

The ONLY mission it provides is very well constructed, challenging and pleasant.
